author: Gwilym Mumford
title: Matrix rebooted: update of dystopian sci-fi franchise in the works
text:
10.08 GMT Last modified on   10.10 GMT 
A new version of popular sci-fi film The Matrix is in development. 
Warner Bros, who produced the original film, are developing an updated version, according to the Hollywood Reporter . Sources suggest the studio is keen to expand the Matrix’s universe in the manner of Disney and Lucasfilm’s recent updates to the Star Wars franchise. Zak Penn, the screenwriter and creator of sci-fi series Alphas, is said to be in talks to write an initial treatment. The Matrix: No 13 best sci-fi and fantasy film of all time Read more 
The first Matrix film was created by the Wachowski siblings and starred Keanu Reeves as Neo, a computer programmer who learns that he and the rest of humanity have been trapped inside a simulated version of reality by sentient machines, and leads a rebellion against his robot overlords. It also featured Carrie-Anne Moss and Laurence Fishburne. Released in 1999, the film immediately became a critical and commercial hit, spawning two less well-received sequels. It has also become enormously influential, with its “ bullet time ” special effects revolutionising action film-making and receiving numerous homages on screen. Keanu Reeves: ‘I don’t know, man. John Wick is fun’ – video interview 
There is no word as to whether Reeves or the Wachowskis would be involved in the new version. Sources told the Hollywood Reporter that there was interest in Michael B Jordan , The Wire and Creed actor, starring in the film. 
Reeves has expressed interest in returning in a further instalment of the franchise, but only if the Wachowskis were involved in its creation. “They would have to write it and direct it. And then we’d see what the story is,”he told Yahoo Movies last month. Topics
